sen.j: 中村水竹 （なかむら すいちく、男性、文化 (元号)3年（1806年） - 明治5年（1872年）1月6日）は、江戸時代末期の日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Suichiku NAKAMURA (male, 1806-January 6, 1872) was a Japanese tenkokukka (artist of seal engraving) in the end of Edo period,
Suichiku NAKAMURA (male, 1806-January 6, 1872) was a Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the end of Edo period,
sen.cmt: tenkokukka→スペルミスのためtenkokukaに訂正しました。
sen.e: Suichiku NAKAMURA (male, 1806-January 6, 1872) was a Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the end of Edo period,

sen.j: 幼名を名霄もしくは天祥、名は元祥、字は爾祥・夢竜。
sen.e: His childhood name was 天祥, his name was 元祥, his azana (adult male's nickname) was 爾祥 and 夢竜.
sen.cmt: 「天祥」「元祥」「爾祥」「夢竜」は読み方不明。
sen.e: His childhood name was 名霄 or 天祥, his name was 元祥, his azana (adult male's nickname) were 爾祥 and 夢竜.
sen.cmt: 「名霄」の訳漏れを訂正しました。（読み方不明です）his azana (adult male's nickname） was→his azana (adult male's nickname） wereに訂正しました。
sen.e: His childhood name was 名霄 or 天祥, his name was 元祥, his azana (adult male's nickname) were 爾祥 and 夢竜.

sen.j: 号 (称号)は水竹の他に酔茗軒。
sen.e: He had a second name or alias of 酔茗軒 in addition to Suichiku.
He had a second name or alias of 酔茗軒 in addition to Suichiku.
He had a second name or alias of 酔茗軒 in addition to Suichiku.

sen.j: 通称は主馬もしくは播磨介。
sen.e: His common name was Shume or Harima no suke.
His common name was Shume or Harima no suke.
His common name was Shume or Harima no suke.
He was from Kyoto Prefecture.
He was from Kyoto Prefecture.
He was from Kyoto Prefecture.
Brief Biography
Brief Biography
Brief Biography

sen.j: 京都西洞院通一条下ル中立売通北に住み、代々近衛家に仕えている。
sen.e: He used to live in north of Nakadachiuri-dori Street, Ichijo Sagaru, Nishinotoin-dori street, Kyoto and served the Konoe Family for generations.
He used to live in north of Nakadachiuri-dori Street, Ichijo Sagaru, Nishinotoin-dori street, Kyoto and had served the Konoe Family for generations.
sen.cmt: served→had servedに時制を訂正しました。「代々仕えた」の部分はhis familyという主語を補足した方が正確だと思いますが、原文に無いので修正は加えませんでした。
sen.e: He used to live in north of Nakadachiuri-dori Street, Ichijo Sagaru, Nishinotoin-dori street, Kyoto and had served the Konoe Family for generations.

sen.j: 篆刻は三雲仙嘯に学んだ。
sen.e: He learned tenkou (seal-engraving) under Sensho MIKUMO.
He learned tenkoku (seal-engraving) under Sensho MIKUMO.
sen.cmt: tenkou→スペルミスのためtenkokuに訂正しました。
sen.e: He learned tenkoku (seal-engraving) under Sensho MIKUMO.

sen.j: 書・文人画に巧みであった。
sen.e: He was good at calligraphy and literati painting.
He was good at calligraphy and literati painting.
He was good at calligraphy and literati painting.

sen.j: 慶応3年に幕命によって御璽・国璽を刻している。
sen.e: In 1867, he made imperial seal and seal of state by order of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
In 1867, he made imperial seal and seal of state by order of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
In 1867, he made imperial seal and seal of state by order of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: ほかに有栖川宮熾仁親王の印も刻した。
sen.e: Also, he engraved a seal for Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Taruhito.
Also, he engraved a seal for Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Taruhito.
Also, he engraved a seal for Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Taruhito.

sen.j: 自印の印譜『水竹丹篆』がある。
sen.e: His Inpu (compilation of seal marks) includes "水竹丹篆."
His Inpu (compilation of seal marks) includes "水竹丹篆."
His Inpu (compilation of seal marks) includes "水竹丹篆."
